name: Glycol Benzylcarbamate
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4471
Reason: 1,2-propanediol base, with a melting point around 50 degrees Celsius, due to the presence of two phenyl groups, which would add approximately +20 degrees Celsius due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. The methoxy group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The carbamate group can participate in hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The benzyl group introduces a rigid structure and additional molecular weight, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius.
